title: Computing History: Teaching With a New Technology
creator_credit: David Tiley, Penny Robins, Video Projects and Commonwealth Schools Commission (Australia)
brief_description: Looks at the use of computers as word-processors and databases in the teaching of history. Programs such as database, newsroom and open database are shown being used. The program also highlights some of the problems, and some of the advantages of using this approach to the teaching of history.
